title: Period of SHM - oscillations per second

content.question: A sphere of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is attached to one end of a string of negligible mass and length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>. The other end of the string is attached to the ceiling. The sphere is displaced slightly from its equilibrium position and released from rest, undergoing simple harmonic motion. Which of the following expressions correctly represents the number of oscillations the sphere completes in one second, assuming the quantities are in conventional <math alttext="S I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>SI</mi></math> units?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 pi times the square root of the fraction L over g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mi>g</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 1 over 2 pi, end fraction, times the square root of the fraction g over L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><msqrt><mfrac><mi>g</mi><mi>L</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="2 pi times the square root of the fraction L over m g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 1 over 2 pi, end fraction, times the square root of the fraction m g over L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>L</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 1 over 2 pi, end fraction, times the square root of the fraction g over L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><msqrt><mfrac><mi>g</mi><mi>L</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
